They Are God's Property.--Orphans who are lent to Christians in trust for God are too often passed by 
                                                                           223
and neglected, and yet they are bought with a price, and are just as valuable in the sight of God as we are. . . . They must be cared for; they must receive special attention. You cannot expend your means in a better way than by opening your doors to make homes for them. When the Lord sees that you are faithful in doing what you can to relieve human misery, He will move upon others to provide means to care for those who need help. Those who enlarge their hearts in this kind of work do no more than their duty.
